result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Nygren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on February 8, 2016 before the Honorable Randy R Koschnick
with penalty chart, JI's and criminal case settlement

Cases 15CF247 & 16CM4 called together at 3:26 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
Defendant Michael R Nygren in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt submits letter along with plea paperwork

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF247 & Count #1-16CM4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 in each case
Court finds in felony matter that Mr. Nygren has been properly charged as and convicted as a repeater

Count #1-15CF247, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 3 and one half years prison consisting of 2 years initial confinement and 18 months of extended supervision and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 

If revoked, the Court finds that Mr. Nygren is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program or Challenge Incareceration.

On Count #1 - 16CM4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (Ct#1-15CF247); to commence 2/13/16 by 7:00 pm  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Complete certified batterers' intervention programming
--No contact with Britta Haraldson except for purposes of participating in court proceedings
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Domestic abuse surcharge (15CF247)
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 1 day-15CF247
Days credit for time already served: 0 days-16CM4

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:59 pm
